result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; 

DNA sample. 

No objection to transfer probation to county of residence.
Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week;

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam M. Kmieciak

records.addlTxt:
Review hearing on October 12, 2023 at 08:15 am.
DEOJ
from defendant requesting clarification of DEOJ agreement regarding firearms

Case Called: 9:31 a.m.
Clerk Micki. 

State appears by ADA Hannah Runde; Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA to: 
COUNT 1 Theft - Movable Property - Special Facts >> NO CONTEST.
COUNT 2 Theft - Movable Property (<=$2500) >> NO CONTEST.

COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers Count 1 for a period of 1 year for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEOJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self, a factual basis & defendant guilty.
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation on count 2; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; No contact with the victims; Restitution in the amount of $4,000.00, plus the 10% surcharge; Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week; CC; and DNA sample and surcharge. No objection to transfer probation to county of residence. Zero days jail credit. 

DEOJ RH>> 10/12/2023 at 8:15 a.m.

Adj: 9:51 a.m.

2:01 p.m.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck. Defendant appears in person, pro se.
Date and time set for preliminary hearing; VRCW. 

COURT questions deft as to right of counsel. 
COURT questions deft as to waiver of preliminary hearing.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 
Plea >> NOT GUILTY. 

Next Hearing >> Previously calendared JPTC/TPD - 10/28/22 at 9:10 a.m.

Adj: 2:13 p.m.

ADA Hannah Boeck appears in person; Defendant appears in person, pro se
DATES:
